channel.description: A Complete Information Portal About the State of Odisha

image.title: Odisha 360 – News, Events and Complete Information About the State

item.title: IMD Predicts Heavy Rainfall across Odisha in Next 48 Hours
item.dc:creator: Odisha360.com Bureau
item.description: Bhubaneswar: Heavy rainfall triggered by a low pressure system over the north Bay of Bengal will lash the state, alerted by the India Meteorological Department (IMD). According to a latest bulletin issued by the Regional Meteorological Centre, heavy rainfall is likely to occur at several places of Malkangiri, Koraput, Rayagada, Gajapati, Kalahandi, Nabarangpur and Nayagarh […]
item.content:encoded:
Bhubaneswar: Heavy rainfall triggered by a low pressure system over the north Bay of Bengal will lash the state, alerted by the India Meteorological Department (IMD).

According to a latest bulletin issued by the Regional Meteorological Centre, heavy rainfall is likely to occur at several places of Malkangiri, Koraput, Rayagada, Gajapati, Kalahandi, Nabarangpur and Nayagarh during next 24 hours.

item.title: 21st Commonwealth Table Tennis Championship to Begin Tomorrow
item.dc:creator: Odisha360.com Bureau
item.description: Cuttack: 21st Commonwealth Table Tennis Championship scheduled to begin Tomorrow at the Jawaharlal Nehru Indoor Stadium, Cuttack. The final list of nations that are participating here include Australia, Bangladesh, Cyprus, England, Malaysia, India, Sri Lanka, Nigeria, Scotland, South Africa, Singapore and Wales. The state government and Odisha State Table Tennis Association are jointly hosting the […]
item.content:encoded:
Cuttack: 21st Commonwealth Table Tennis Championship scheduled to begin Tomorrow at the Jawaharlal Nehru Indoor Stadium, Cuttack.

The final list of nations that are participating here include Australia, Bangladesh, Cyprus, England, Malaysia, India, Sri Lanka, Nigeria, Scotland, South Africa, Singapore and Wales.

The state government and Odisha State Table Tennis Association are jointly hosting the championships.

item.title: Thunderstorm and Lightning Alert Issued for 12 Districts in Odisha
item.dc:creator: Odisha360.com Bureau
item.description: Bhubaneswar: The Regional Meteorological Centre has issued a thunderstorm alert for twelve districts of Odisha namely Koraput, Rayagada, Kalahandi, Kandhamal, Nuapada, Bolangir, Boudh, Nayagarh, Khurda, Gajapati, Ganjam and Puri today. Moderate thunderstorm and lightning with rainfall is likely to occur, the Met release read.
item.content:encoded:
Bhubaneswar: The Regional Meteorological Centre has issued a thunderstorm alert for twelve districts of Odisha namely Koraput, Rayagada, Kalahandi, Kandhamal, Nuapada, Bolangir, Boudh, Nayagarh, Khurda, Gajapati, Ganjam and Puri today.

Moderate thunderstorm and lightning with rainfall is likely to occur, the Met release read.

item.title: Rath Yatra 2019: Adhara Pana Ritual to be Held Today
item.dc:creator: Odisha360.com Bureau
item.description: Bhubaneswar: A day after the holy trinity adorned the golden attire, it is time for observing the ‘Adhara Pana’ ritual, wherein, a rich drink will be offered to the trinity by priests today. It is believed that the deities are tired with the journey during Bahuda and then when they also got ready to give […]
item.content:encoded:
Bhubaneswar: A day after the holy trinity adorned the golden attire, it is time for observing the ‘Adhara Pana’ ritual, wherein, a rich drink will be offered to the trinity by priests today.

It is believed that the deities are tired with the journey during Bahuda and then when they also got ready to give their devotees a special darshan of their ‘Suna Besha’, they become extremely tired.

The “Pana” is made of a mixture of milk cream, cheese, sugar, banana, camphor, nuts, black pepper apart from various herbal plant extracts, including tulasi that are blended into the drink.

The beverage is then filled in nine earthen pots. The pots are long cylindrical shaped so that they reach the height of the deities’ lips. The deities are offered three pots each. After consecrating, the pots are smashed right there on the chariots, so that the drink flows all over the chariot.

item.title: Rath Yatra 2019: Lakhs of Devotees Throng Puri for Suna Besha of Lord Jagannath
item.dc:creator: Odisha360.com Bureau
item.description: Bhubaneswar: Lakhs of devotees thronged to Puri today to witness the holy Trinity in their golden glory during the Suna Besha ritual today. As per ritual Lord Balabhadra, Lord Jagannath and Devi Subhadra will be adorned with gold ornaments. The Suna Besha ritual will start at 4:00 PM today followed by Sandhya Dhupa at 8:00 […]
item.content:encoded:
Bhubaneswar: Lakhs of devotees thronged to Puri today to witness the holy Trinity in their golden glory during the Suna Besha ritual today.

As per ritual Lord Balabhadra, Lord Jagannath and Devi Subhadra will be adorned with gold ornaments.

The Suna Besha ritual will start at 4:00 PM today followed by Sandhya Dhupa at 8:00 PM and Chandan Lagi at 12:30 AM.

A glimpse of the deities on this occasion is considered to be very auspicious.

item.title: Rath Yatra 2019: Devotees Throng Puri for Bahuda Yatra of Lord Jagannath
item.dc:creator: Odisha360.com Bureau
item.description: Bhubaneswar: Lakhs of devotees from across the country converged on Odisha’s temple town of Puri today to witness the Bahuda Yatra (homecoming festival) of the deities of Sri Jagannath temple. The Bahuda Yatra is held eight days after the annual Rath Yatra, which marks the journey of Lord Jagannath, elder brother Balabhadra and sister Subhadra, […]
item.content:encoded:
Bhubaneswar: Lakhs of devotees from across the country converged on Odisha’s temple town of Puri today to witness the Bahuda Yatra (homecoming festival) of the deities of Sri Jagannath temple.

The Bahuda Yatra is held eight days after the annual Rath Yatra, which marks the journey of Lord Jagannath, elder brother Balabhadra and sister Subhadra, from the 12th century Jagannath temple in three splendidly decorated wooden chariots to Gundicha temple, about two km away.

The return of the deities follows the same rituals as performed during the Ratha Yatra.

A glimpse of the deities on the chariots during the Rath Yatra and Bahuda Yatra is considered to be very auspicious.

item.title: Odisha CM Naveen Inaugurates State’s First Haj House in Bhubaneswar
item.dc:creator: Odisha360.com Bureau
item.description: Bhubaneswar: Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik inaugurated Odisha’s first Haj House in Bhubaneswar on Wednesday. The Haj House will facilitate transit accomodation and training to Haj pilgrims of the state. Patnaik also felicitated the Haj pilgrims. This year as many as 653 persons from the state will go on Haj pilgrimage to Mecca in Saudi Arabia […]
item.content:encoded:
Bhubaneswar: Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik inaugurated Odisha’s first Haj House in Bhubaneswar on Wednesday.

The Haj House will facilitate transit accomodation and training to Haj pilgrims of the state.

Patnaik also felicitated the Haj pilgrims.

This year as many as 653 persons from the state will go on Haj pilgrimage to Mecca in Saudi Arabia between July 25 and August 5.

item.title: Ace Sprinter Dutee Chand Clinches Gold at 30th Summer Universiade Games in Naples
item.dc:creator: Odisha360.com Bureau
item.description: Bhubaneswar: Ace Sprinter Dutee Chand clinched gold medal in women’s 100m event at the 30th Summer Universiade Napoli 2019, Italy on Tuesday, clocking a time of 11.32 seconds. This is the first time an Indian has won a 100-meter gold at this global event. Chand is a two-time Asian champion and the holder of the 100-meter national record.
item.content:encoded:
Bhubaneswar: Ace Sprinter Dutee Chand clinched gold medal in women’s 100m event at the 30th Summer Universiade Napoli 2019, Italy on Tuesday, clocking a time of 11.32 seconds.

This is the first time an Indian has won a 100-meter gold at this global event.

Chand is a two-time Asian champion and the holder of the 100-meter national record.

item.title: Musical Event ‘Guhari’ to Invoke Lord Jagannath through Music
item.dc:creator: Odisha360.com Bureau
item.description: Bhubaneswar: Eminent artistes as well as young talents of the state are rendering some of the most celebrated songs dedicated to Lord Jagannath at a three-day musical concert ‘Guhari’, that commenced at Rabindra Mandap, here on Monday. The event is being hosted in the city by the state culture department through Guru Kelucharan Mohapatra Odissi […]
item.content:encoded:
Bhubaneswar: Eminent artistes as well as young talents of the state are rendering some of the most celebrated songs dedicated to Lord Jagannath at a three-day musical concert ‘Guhari’, that commenced at Rabindra Mandap, here on Monday.

The event is being hosted in the city by the state culture department through Guru Kelucharan Mohapatra Odissi Research Centre.

The inaugural evening saw renditions by well-known artistes including Shantilata Chhotray among many other young singers. They performed many songs that are famous since ancient times. The audience that comprised mostly of Lord Jagannath devotees appreciated the performance and found themselves lost in devotion.

Many instrumentalists will also perform during the event as accompanists as well as for instrumental renditions of various devotional songs.

The event is a part of the state culture department’s multiple programmes to promote and celebrate Rath Yatra.

item.title: Rath Yatra 2019: Hera Panchami at Gundicha Temple
item.dc:creator: Odisha360.com Bureau
item.description: Bhubaneswar: With the trio of Lord Jagannath, Balabhadra and Goddess Subhadra enjoying their stay at their aunt’s place in Gundicha temple, it is time for Goddess Lakshmi, who was not taken along for the vacation, to show her anger during the Hera Panchami rituals that is to be observed today. Hera Panchami is observed on […]
item.content:encoded:
Bhubaneswar: With the trio of Lord Jagannath, Balabhadra and Goddess Subhadra enjoying their stay at their aunt’s place in Gundicha temple, it is time for Goddess Lakshmi, who was not taken along for the vacation, to show her anger during the Hera Panchami rituals that is to be observed today.

Hera Panchami is observed on the fifth day of the rath yatra. The rituals of this day have special significance in the nine-day festival.

On this day, Goddess Lakshmi, wife of Lord Jagannath, pays a visit to him at the Gundicha temple to request him to come back to the Jagannath temple.

To represent Goddess Lakshmi, the idol of Subarna Mahalakshmi is carried to the Gundicha temple from the Jagannath temple on a palanquin in a grand procession by the servitors. The priests at the Gundicha temple receive the goddess and felicitate her after which she is escorted to the sanctum.

But while returning in the evening, following the goddess’ wish, one of her servitors breaks a portion of the Nandighosha (Lord Jagannath’s chariot), which is known as the Ratha Bhanga Neeti.
